column5: Do you need to remove the cover, or the drain plug?
Keep the cover on, that way they don't see the beer. Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
Have never been asked to remove cover. Have never had drain plug in so can't answer that. Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
Minnesota requires plugs to be removed when traveling on the highway. So, depending upon where you're crossing yes. The cover no. Unless they ask you to pull over to inspect.
Sometimes the officials will ask to remove part of the cover so they can look inside. Sometimse they'll ask the cover be removed. In any case, don't do anything until asked, then do it. Bill

Minnesota has always asked if the plug is in the boat. Last few years rainy river agents have asked if it's in?? So unplug it. I've heard that if you're driving in Minnesota the plug is to be unplugged. It's the law the sign says.
